title: (41540) La Puebla de Cazalla - 22 Polígono Industrial los Pollitos
title_short: (41540) La Puebla de Cazalla - 22 Polígono Industrial los Pollitos
description: Spectacular motorhome pitch in an arabesque village 70km from Seville. Each station, well defined and with enough space between one camper and the other, is equipped with supply and disposal and a pillar for the electricity connection (both normal and Schuko). There are also bathrooms with toilets and showers with hot water. Everything is free, maximum length of stay 72 hours. There is a small bar where you can eat and drink until late.

Driving up to the parking spaces is also a problem for large motorhomes. electricity is provided everywhere, but they do not work. there is also no tap at the water connection. a very expensive investment by the village, but with bad results.

title: (41550) Aguadulce - 15b Avenida Aguadulce

The toilets are 1km before the field, at the restaurant (it closes early, before 8 p.m.) Be careful, the GPS point is poorly located. After the GPS point you have to continue for another 1km then turn left, follow the sign for Chaparro de la Vega. (arriving from Malaga). We spent the night without any problems

title: (11689) La Muela -
description:
From the road, follow the very good dirt road for 1km; keep straight on it. Super accessible. It is a big clearing with many picnic tables and fire places and big waste bins. Secluded, completely quiet and shaded by trees, if you want. The clearing is - except for the entrance - protected by rocks and fences.
There are some big pigs on farmland right next to the clearing. Some few almost level spots, most parts a little bit sloped. Too many giant motorhomes at the same time probably don't fit well, but there is lots of space.
You can easily stay there over night(s).

title: (41657) Los Corrales -
description: New motorhome area recently opened, showers soon. A place with tables to eat and shade and a source of drinking water, the night is very very quiet and it is allowed to take out an awning and tables right next to the football field and running tracks open for your use. Close to the center, there is a 2 supermarkets, ambulatory ... right next to it there is a gas station. It is 30 minutes from the king's path.

title: (11690) Olvera - CA-9106
description: Parking with a superb view of Olvera. Picnic tables available and trash cans. Just above the very beautiful Sanctuary Nuestra Seniora de los Remedios, to visit (free), where there are toilets and picnic tables, and an inn opposite. Just below, near the old washhouse, a permanent water point.

title: (41770) Montellano - A-8127
description: Parking lot, underground meadow, with picnic tables and rubbish bins on a street with little traffic

title: (11693) Alcalá del Valle -
description:
Esplanade of Caños Santos (Alcalá del Valle), isolated and supportive, easily accessible and fairly level. Pure tranquility for those who seek to get away from everyday noise. Some weekends they come from the surroundings to visit the convent and stay for a picnic, but few. Please, let's take care of these beautiful places by taking our garbage with us!!

Starting point for mountain bike excursions. Lots of tracks.

title: (11689) La Muela - CA-9101
description: Luga and overnight parking, shaded in the morning and near games for children.

Quiet place in the middle of town during the week, recommended by people from the town since we asked where to sleep and they sent us there. Things to keep in mind: -In the open field right next to it there is a bar-concert hall -On Wednesdays there is a market, so if you sleep there on a Tuesday you may not be able to leave until noon. The photo is from google maps because we didn't take a photo the same day and I made the post later... they recently built some public toilets, but I don't know the hours of these toilets

Town hall and picturesque square, public swimming pool and various mountain water sources. Ideal site for hiking and biking.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 3 Diseminado Huerta del Fresno
description: Motorhome area at the entrance of the town, it is not necessary to enter the town to access the Motorhome area, thus avoiding loss of location or traffic problems. Urban center 500 meters. The Algonodonales Town Hall page offers more information and directions. Flat place, with some shade, benches and space for about 50 motorhomes. It is the fairground of the town that is used when there is no fair. Beautiful town, with a great atmosphere all year round and the possibility of doing numerous adventure activities. Cheap restaurants and homemade food.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 5 A-384
description: Free parking without service. There is a restaurant next door and opposite a gas station with a 3/4 thread tap to take water

description: Next to the road, but pretty calm place to stay overnight.

name: CIVA
title: (11680) CIVA
description: Paragliding and Hanggliding pilots welcome! Parking facility by CIVA, freshwater, WC, shower, pool and bar are at disposal for guests. No electricity provided. Nice place in familiar and quiet surroundings. 20 minutes footwalk to the center of Algodonales. Small bars and restaurants within 5 min. Distance.

title: (41410) Carmona - 7 Calle Puerta Marchena
description:
Parking on the street. Wonderful wiev and beutiful sunset and sunrise. Many cars, becasuse is the road for the big parking, and hotel, but it was calm in the night.
Police had no problem with us, but our recomendation: use this spot only in winter, be very polite and respect this place.

title_short: (41710) Utrera - 24 Calle Salvador de Quinta Rodríguez

Ideal for spending the night before going to wear out your shoes on the footbridges of Caminito del Rey!

title: (41710) Urbanización San Nicolás -
description:
Finca Angela Sevilla has 8 very spacious and rustic camper pitches. Caravans are certainly also welcome.

Quietly located in the wide fields of the picturesque town of Utrera (4 km). Seville is 25 kilometers further and is easily accessible by train from Utrera.

There is a transfer service to Utrera and vice versa. On Tuesdays and Fridays you can enjoy a delicious dinner in the house restaurant with the other campers. A wonderful massage by a Dutch, professional therapist is also possible. There is also a fresh bread service for the morning.

The owners (Angela and James) are a very hospitable and enthusiastic Dutch couple.

Note: Only use Google Maps to get there. Your car navigation sends you all the way through the bush, which can cause you to get stuck. Or ask for or download the directions on the website. This one is very clear.

Reservations are necessary!

Dutch, English, German and Spanish are spoken here.

description:
Following a rocky road you arrive at a flat space next to the lake. The location is surrounded by trees and wild growth. Great camping spot.
I came with a small van, would not recommend it for motorhomes, the other side of the lake has more accessible spots though.
A few children came by in the evening (saturday) but otherwise very few human sounds
